title: (11650) Villamartin - 2 Calle Violeta
description: Gas Station with Repsol regular propane ( 11 kg size ) & butane gas cylinders available, opens from 6 am till 10 pm everyday

title: (11650) Villamartin - 4 Calle detrás Jerez-Ronda
description: Parking on the outskirts of the town, near the sports center and the fairgrounds.

title: (11650) Villamartin - 55C Avenida de Arcos
description: Service station with AdBlue and LPG service as well as CEPSA bottles and car wash also for motorhome

title: (11650) Villamartin - 55C Avenida de Arcos
description: Dirt parking at the entrance of Villamartin. Convenient for visiting the city center, 20 minutes on foot. Excellent typical sweets of the place. Next to it is a petrol station.

title: (11650) Villamartin - A-373
description: Parking next to the gas station. Toilets and water available. Ask at the gas station if you can stay. Close to the supermarket 5 minutes walk. Next to Villamartin.

title: (11650) Villamartín - A-384
description: Repsol station to collect water, and car wash services, propane cylinders

title: (11649) Coto de Bornos -
description: A tranquil semi flat plot on the banks of the Bornos lake accessible for campervan a who don’t mind veering off tarmacked roads and into nature. The lake may be full or, like in March 2023, looking rather empty. Otherwise a great place for kayaking or even swimming but you may have to walk to get to the waters edge if low water levels.  Very green in spring be ready to be ambushed by horses and cows . The view when you wake up is stunningly baby blue and green .  So, although this is not a camp site as such, there are no signs prohibiting camping or doing overnight stays. We have done so a few times and seems like this is tolerated……

title: (11650) Villamartin - CA-8101
description: Picnic area with toilets (not very clean) games for children ... Can be a place where we could spend the night (to be confirmed). We were just passing there.

title: (11640) Bornos -
description: Lake spot by Bornos about 50 min Granada. Town 500m away with cafe etc and a beautiful free walked garden and town WiFi. Flat, lake and mountain view, walking around lake

title: (11640) Bornos - 51 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: The landscape is very beautiful - very narrow and sometimes poor access.

title: (11640) Bornos - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place with a view!!! Definitely worth it!!

title: (11640) Bornos -
description: In front of the lake possibility of putting it in the shade sloping ground but you can dig easily and put calles not far from the city but it is very quiet (done with a van. to be tested for cc)

title: (11640) Bornos - 56 Calle Río Guadalete
description: drinking fountain

title: (11660) Prado del Rey -
description: Very quiet place at the entrance to the Sierra de Cádiz, great amplitude next to a sanctuary.

title: (11640) Bornos - 1 Plaza las Monjas
description: Ample place to park up to AC of 7 meters. Next to a square with a playground for children and a bar with a terrace. To spend the day I think nobody would tell you anything to park.

title: (41760) El Coronil - A-375
description: Beginning of the greenway seen from the port of Serrano and Olvera Coripe, free parking, few places to van or small motorhome given the limitation of space and the presence of sun roofs at some places.

name: CAT Lake Bornos
title: (11640) CAT Lake Bornos
description:
ALWAYS CALL BEFOREHAND SINCE AIR SPORTS EVENTS MAY BE TAKING PLACE AT THE TIME YOU WANT TO STAY THERE ...

 Excellent & Tranquil Campsite on the shores of Lake Bornos, with spectacular views of the lake & distant mountains, and an amazing sunrise . Owner Francisco is really helpful & friendly. Starting point of walks, hikes , motorbike & cycling, kayaking from here, very good restaurants around the village of Bornos , Dia supermarket & gas stations. Special place to be for flying enthusiasts , ideal for paramotoring & powered trike flying, the campsite caters also as a powered paragliding school. Takeoff and landing spots just minutes away from campsite. Highly recommend if in the area or nearby...important to enter the road from Hermegas Bornos ( see attached pic) , ONLY easily accessible for motorhomes from that direction !

title: (11640) Bornos - 37 Avenida de la Diputación
description: Free parking in front of the camping place. Flat and clean. Very bright during the night. Walking distance from the city. Much cleaner than the place next to this. Might be full in the summer though. Also toilets next to the place, but they are closed right now.

title: (11640) Bornos - 58 Calle Puerto
description: Quiet place in the urban area where you can park to visit the town or rest from the trip. There is no service of any kind, only garbage containers. Together Public school.

title: (11640) Bornos - 37 Avenida de la Diputación
description: A nice place not very big, but people very friendly, forbidden to stay. You can swim in the lake.

title: (11640) Bornos -
description: In height in front of the lake exceptional sunrise for vehicles of 6m max to be able to turn around in the path not far from the city but in a quiet area beautiful walk to do on foot or mountain bike beware of the end of glass (Spain...)

title: (11648) Espera - 1000A Calle 1º de Mayo
description: Several car parks (4 or 5) between this point (2) and the castle. Calm and safe. You have to cross the town, so it will not be comfortable for ACs over 6.5m

title: (41770) Montellano - 62 Calle Morón
description: Water fountain easy to fill the van with.

title: (11659) Puerto Serrano - CA-4404
description: Area next to the road between Puerto Serrano and Coripe. Road with very little traffic and very quiet. More crowded on weekends for being a hunting area.

title: (41770) Montellano - A-8127
description: Parking lot, underground meadow, with picnic tables and rubbish bins on a street with little traffic

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 8 Avenida Príncipe de España
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 8 Avenida Príncipe de España
description: Near the leisure and catering base, on line parking by the lake in a dead end. No prohibition sign.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
description: Quiet area, you can swim, artificial beach on the lake with spectacular views, with tables, WC, bar-restaurant. You cannot camp but you can spend the night, there is a campsite nearby.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
description: Free water tap at the beach. Quier if you come in the morning or at night. Cold shower also available.

title: (41770) Montellano -
description: Easily accessible via paved road, nature park with barbecue areas and picnic tables. Parking available, not quite flat. Hardly any mobile reception. Very nice atmosphere, absolutely calm

name: Camping Lago de Arcos
title: (11630) Camping Lago de Arcos
description: Located in Arcos de la Frontera, Cádiz. Accessible and comfortable, close to the town, to all kinds of attractions and tourist attractions adapted to all tastes and ages. From a quiet walk to an afternoon of nautical activities on the lake, eating typical products or a hiking route. We offer offers in low season.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 185 Avenida Sombrero de Tres Picos
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 185 Avenida Sombrero de Tres Picos
description: Quiet and free parking at the lake.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 6 Calle Pintor Goya
description: Small quiet parking with lake view. Close to other small car parks, without services. To date, no overnight accommodation problems.

title: (41770) Montellano - Unnamed Road
description: Mirador del Pancorbo. Beautiful hilltop with stunning views, plenty of shade trees, flat areas, and picnic tables.  Just a few hundred meters from a paragliding launch with mobil bar. Last section is dirt, but no problem with our 2wd camper pulling a trailer.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - C-344
description: Private area of payment guarded and with perimeter fence, gate closed at night, paved, with water and electricity service. Good views of the town qda about 15 minutes by bike. Restaurant in the same area, good prices. Arches of the border. Very tourist town, castle, medieval churches and narrow alleys.  Call if the door is closed

title: (11670) El Bosque - Calle Rafael Alberti
description: Parking near children's park. Parking along the roadway. Almost no traffic. On Sunday a little parking of vehicles that visit the museum of cheese "El Bosqueno". Quiet place, lighted and well placed to visit the city.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 5 Calle Pintor Francisco Bayeu
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 5 Calle Pintor Francisco Bayeu
description: Quiet parking at the end of a dead end at the lake. Very quiet, and without the traffic of the other 2 spots nearby ... In the middle of palm trees!

title: (11670) El Bosque - 16 Camino del Espino
description: Parking at the start of the hike. A very quiet place without outside light. At the edge of a river in 1 min and a half. Road with potholes for the last 300 meters. I stayed there all day and all night (no sign indicates prohibition) 4min by car you are at a Bar / Restaurant at the edge of the water (easy parking space)

title: (11670) El Bosque - 15 Calle Jaen
description: We did not sleep here but I believe it is possible without any problems. park to right side of road. we only posted up during the day. In quiet area away from town and homes, opposite a natural reserve with a natural stream with small beach to relax. A good hiking trail departs from this section also. fairly flat parking space for 1-2 small vans. Less flat space for more. great 4G reception and just 3 mins from pueblo El Bosque. not ideal for bigger campers. the hostel that you park next to is currently closed, to your benefit. drinking water fountain right there

name: Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
title: (11670) Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
title_short: (11670) Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
description: I have been coming to this town, since I have great friends here, even before being a caravanner. Having an overnight area here is wonderful. There are neighbors who don't see it well and after being here for a few days I have verified that sometimes we have what we deserve. I have been able to verify how, despite the fact that there is a place designated for dumping, there were buses going here that, while they were parked, opened valves and gradually dumped, the ones with a gasoline generator set, they had it running late at night, bothering the the neighbors and other caravaners. Let's have civility please, so we will have more opportunities and places, and we will be better seen and treated. Congratulations on the app.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 30 Calle los Perales
description: Parking on the street. It is level. Very quiet place to spend the night. Nothing is heard, only the sound of a nearby river. When we arrived there were several Ac and Campers staying overnight. Recommendable.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 1 Avenida Diputacion
description: Parking area in the village for about 20 AC. Park for children and walk. Quiet starting at 00h. Close to typical shops and areas to eat and near the beautiful path of the Majaceite river towards Benamahoma

title: (11670) El Bosque - 15 Poligono del Anden
description: Drinking Water Supply for free

title: (11670) El Bosque - 8 Calle Juan Ramón Jiménez
title_short: (11670) El Bosque - 8 Calle Juan Ramón Jiménez
description: A parking space before the bridge, flat parking, very little passage, this is not the ideal spot but we were quiet for one night.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 59 Avenida del Santiscal
description: Small parking lot at the end of a dead end street.  Calm and pleasant.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 18 Calle Benamahoma
description: Good place to spend the night in the forest, quiet place

title: (11670) El Bosque - Camino del Castillejo
description: Botanical Garden Parking

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - C-334
description: A recreational area without services but perfect to rest and walk with a view of the town of arches of the border, many pines and very shady, it is not forbidden to stay overnight as there is no sign that prohibits it. next gas stations services.

title: (11680) Algodonales - Carretera de Antequera
description: Ideal place to rest and spend the day. Guadalete river at 20 meters.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera -
description: Quiet place in a pine forest, to rest for a while or even spend the night. Only the cars on the road can be heard a little.

title: (11670) El Bosque - Canada de Villamartina
description: Recreational area, with picnic tables and barbecues. It is not well cared for and there is some garbage, but it is a quiet place, with a lot of shade and with the forest river right here. Easy access by a dirt track in very good condition. Only local people walk, it is not an area full of tourism like others around, that's why we liked it. Let's keep this beautiful and accessible space clean.

name: Camping la Torrecilla
title: (11670) Camping la Torrecilla
description: A very familiar and beautiful place, views of nature and tranquility. The owners are very friendly, affordable price.

title: (11670) El Bosque -
description: Go up to see the sunset, with a friend. And I saw that there is space to park motorhome or peasant and be able to spend a stay outdoors in nature

title: (11670) El Bosque - 102 Diseminado los Catorce
description: A picnic area with a couple of relativity flat spots for a motorhome 2km outside El Bosque. The parking is mainly on a hill is sandy and rocky. There are public toilets here also. There are no services only bins. We seen people fill their water bottles from the running stream. There are two entrances with low branches at the first so go to the second. There is a house across the road and a rooster may wake you early.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 2 Calle República Dominicana
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 2 Calle República Dominicana
description: Gray and black water discharge services and drinking water to load, central area but easily accessible dinoverde car washes

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 10-22 Calle Salida del Puente
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 10-22 Calle Salida del Puente
description: Parking with great views of Arcos de la Frontera. Without any service. Possible night off season. It can be complicated to turn around for long motorhomes.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 33 Calle Peña
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 33 Calle Peña
description: Parking place to spend the night with incredible views of the Castle. quiet and no traffic

name: CIVA
title: (11680) CIVA
description: Paragliding and Hanggliding pilots welcome! Parking facility by CIVA, freshwater, WC, shower, pool and bar are at disposal for guests. No electricity provided. Nice place in familiar and quiet surroundings. 20 minutes footwalk to the center of Algodonales. Small bars and restaurants within 5 min. Distance.

title: (11679) Benamahoma - 1 Calle la Venta
description: Quiet place ideal for overnight and hiking trails, bar attached to the parking.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
description: Just the side of a lane with walkers and a few cars. Enough for small van. But great views of the cliffs at night. And amazing number of egrets in the trees on the little island. Probably over 100 roosting overnight.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Av. Duque de Arcos
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Av. Duque de Arcos
description: Large dirt parking without service. Ideal for visiting the beautiful village of Arcos de la Frontera. We did not spend the night, but it seems that the night parking is tolerated on this car park (according to other motorhomes).

title: (11680) Algodonales - Pk. 43 A-384
description: Free water at Repsol gas station to refill vans or bottles.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Ramón Vázquez Orellana
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Ramón Vázquez Orellana
description: This small laundry is the only place in Arcos de la Frontera where you can have your clothes washed. The laundry is labeled "dry cleaning", but they also offer a normal laundry service. The next day we were able to pick up our freshly washed and folded clothes from the friendly señora. It is really recommended!

title: (11680) Algodonales - 5 A-384
description: Free parking without service. There is a restaurant next door and opposite a gas station with a 3/4 thread tap to take water

title: (11679) Benamahoma - 26 Calle la Venta
description: Renowned fountain. Fresh water of quality. The inhabitants supply themselves in large numbers. Easy access by road.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Antonio y Carlos Murciano
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Antonio y Carlos Murciano
description: Unpaved parking in front of the Bus Station. Passable road with large AC. Near other car parks visible on P4N. No problem to stay overnight, quiet area. We are in mid-November 2022. In twenty minutes on foot you can reach the historic center, full of history. Recommended.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera -
description: Before the other area with several reviews, directly opposite the farm by the river. We preferred to stay here as access was easier and the other area was full with 3 vans already. The area I can be quite busy during the day with families visiting.

name: Camping Los Linares
title: (11679) Camping Los Linares
description: Large camping. Very clean and organised. 50 + camp/ motorhome pitches. Warm douches very quiet in mid season. Friendly staff. Swimming pool.

title: (11680) Arenal - Carr. de Antequera
description: Very quiet place to spend the night

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Los Cabezuelos
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Los Cabezuelos
description: By the river (swimming possible) and very quiet. Little shade and a lot of rubbish unfortunately but perfect for the night. A herd of cow comes on the ground at sunset but does not stay long. Also suitable for large motorhomes but flat terrain limited to 3-4

title: (11680) Algodonales - 3 Diseminado el Arenal
description: Manned launderette, open Monday to Friday. From 09.30 to 13.30.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera -
description: Incredible views towards the Peña de Arcos, perfect place to park, motorhomes, etc. Very spacious, on both sides of the river.

title: (41719) El Palmar de Troya -
description:
Following a rocky road you arrive at a flat space next to the lake. The location is surrounded by trees and wild growth. Great camping spot.
I came with a small van, would not recommend it for motorhomes, the other side of the lake has more accessible spots though.
A few children came by in the evening (saturday) but otherwise very few human sounds

title: (11680) Algodonales - 3 Diseminado Huerta del Fresno
description: Motorhome area at the entrance of the town, it is not necessary to enter the town to access the Motorhome area, thus avoiding loss of location or traffic problems. Urban center 500 meters. The Algonodonales Town Hall page offers more information and directions. Flat place, with some shade, benches and space for about 50 motorhomes. It is the fairground of the town that is used when there is no fair. Beautiful town, with a great atmosphere all year round and the possibility of doing numerous adventure activities. Cheap restaurants and homemade food.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 17 Calle Canalejas
description: Municipal parking very city. Forbidden to vehicles over 5m

title: () Grazalema - A-372
description: Recreational area in meadow with tables and barbecues, very wide. Sand parking area.

title: (11688) Zahara - CA-8102
description: Place it in the shade at the edge of a small river where it can swim. On the road but quiet. Ideal for a lunch.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 49 Avenida de la Constitución
description: Hardware store Rodríguez, ideal to buy a blue BUTSIR gas bottle of 2.8 kg. It's at number 54, on Avenida de la Constitución, opposite the bakery. Ramón is the owner and he is very friendly.

name: Área de Autocaravanas de Coripe
title: (41780) Área de Autocaravanas de Coripe
description: Zone in the same city with all services. Everything is free. A few minutes away is the leisure area of Chaparro.

title: (41710) Utrera - Unnamed Road
description: Related to the neighboring spot. Just to show that there is really a lot of space here. LTE partially available.

title: (41710) Utrera - Unnamed Road
description: Place in the middle of nature facing the lake, do not hesitate to walk along the paths, several spots, picnic table. No regulatory height and flat land 1 hour from Seville.

title: (41719) Guadalema de los Quinteros - CA-31
description: Resting place in the shade of eucalyptus trees, tables and benches to use. We took a refreshing nap in the afternoon.

title: (41780) Coripe - 1 Diseminado la Vega
description: Chaparro de la Vega. It is a beautiful large lot, with several barbecue, garbage cans, water point and a church. Contrary to what is written on the sign, there are no toilets on site. The toilets are 1km before the field, at the restaurant (it closes early, before 8 p.m.) Be careful, the GPS point is poorly located. After the GPS point you have to continue for another 1km then turn left, follow the sign for Chaparro de la Vega. (arriving from Malaga). We spent the night without any problems

title: (11689) La Muela - CA-9101
description: Luga and overnight parking, shaded in the morning and near games for children.

title: (41780) Algodonales - Via Verdes de la Sierra
title_short: (41780) Algodonales - Via Verdes de la Sierra
description: Parking Coripe station, on the same greenway, very nice

title: (41719) Utrera - 49 Urbanizacion la Cañada
description: At the foot of the torre de l'Aguila. The climb is difficult (reserved for 4x4 or intrepid van) but the view absolutely splendid. Upstairs there is a small bench where you can spend the night. Below the lake there is another place where you can go if there is too much wind at the top.

title: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 104 CA-31
title_short: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 104 CA-31
description: Service station with water and hose plug. It has a restaurant nearby too.

title: (41710) Utrera - N-480
description: Asphalted parking with delimitation for motorhomes and trucks of the sale El Paisano. Upgrade with non-potable water tap (well) for filling and at the same place three drains for black drainage. The grid for the grays has not been put to today. It's along the highway, at night there is little traffic and enough trucks at night, that's for sure. The store has many typical products of the region. Thank you for the services.

title: (41760) El Coronil - SE-437
description: Recreational area with easy access, equipped with picnic areas. Parking on a slope, dirt.

title: (11680) Algodonales - Avenida de la Fuente Alta
title_short: (11680) Algodonales - Avenida de la Fuente Alta
description: Free parking in front of a bar, 50 meters from a fountain to drink water and 5 min from the center

title: (11680) Algodonales - 77 Avenida de Andalucia
description: A source of drinkable mountain water that tastes better than the surrounding water, locals also come to fill cans here. Small car park minute stop in front authorized to take water.

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra -
description: Small parking lot near the lake with a nice view of the surrounding mountains. small picnic area right next door and start of the hike 5 minutes away on foot. ideal for swimming in the lake or fishing. Forbidden at night.

title: (41780) Coripe - Cam. Cementerio
description: A quiet and peaceful place away from the city

title: () Algodonales - Unnamed Road
description:
No water.
Great for those who like to be alone in nature

title: () Algar - Unnamed Road
description: Place for a vehicle at the edge of a dirt road in the middle of nature. The small river on the side brings a great "zen sound" for the night. Not perfectly flat. There was a bigger place on the same road before, but families were already there and were organizing a small party.

title: (11688) Zahara - 7 Calle El Pilar
description: Parking near the viewpoint of Zahara de la Sierra, with a magnificent view of the city.

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 7 Avenida Andalucia
title_short: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 7 Avenida Andalucia
description: Parking space on the edge of the old town of Zahara, under the Guardia Civil. Access to a length of about 8m. Nice view over the countryside.

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 2 Camino Algodonales
title_short: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 2 Camino Algodonales
description: Non-chlorinated water source (that is, it is not treated with chemicals). It does not say that it is not drinkable, it tastes good. A man from the village told me that it is spring water.

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 7 Calle Jose Maria Peman
title_short: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 7 Calle Jose Maria Peman
description: Place to spend the night in the beautiful town of Zahara de la Sierra, of everything we have seen in the town I think it is the most beautiful for views and for the leveling of the land, it is located next to the road that gives access to the castle. You have to be careful with the trees that are on the promenade and that invade part of the parking area, it is valid with care for large volume vans and small Camper, refrain motorhomes.

title: (11688) Zahara - CA-9104
description: Parking next to the road, great location for sightseeing and overlooking the dam. I guess at night little traffic, so it can also be a good place for the night.

title: (11688) Zahara - 7 Calle Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente
title_short: (11688) Zahara - 7 Calle Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente
description: Free zone next to the lake under a car park

address.street: 7 Calle Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 15 Calle El Fuerte
title_short: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 15 Calle El Fuerte
description: Water tap

title: (11688) El Gastor - A-2300
description: Corner next to the road, a few meters from the lake. incredible views in the morning. At night a lot of air, we had to sleep inside the camper on the bottom. Although it is next to the road, hardly any vehicles pass.

title: (11639) Algar - 25 CA-6104
description: Gas station, kind owner allow to refull water tank for free

title: (11639) Algar - 39 Calle San José
description: Parking at the school. Close to the center and a playground.

title: (11688) El Gastor - A-2300
description:
Small parking for a discreet place down the road. Here also beautiful views of the lake. It must be recognized that sloping access is not necessarily within the reach of the campsite owner who fears for his machine. My truck, 7m, went well.
Forbidden to stay for the night.

title: () Zahara de la Sierra -
description: Drinking water

title: (11688) El Gastor - A-2300
description: Ideal for a day

title: (11610) Grazalema - CA-9104
description: Magnificent views of the lake and the mountain at 360 degrees. Quiet despite the roadsides and flat terrain. Internet network.

title: (11610) Grazalema - CA-9104
description: View point. Can be windy!!

title: (11610) Grazalema - A-372
description: Nice vantage point with a fountain. It fits only one car/ small bus/ camper.

title: (11639) Algar -
description:
SANTA MARGARITA RURAL FINCA EL PIKETA. Private property with all services for AC. An ideal place to rest, enjoy nature and its animals. Spectacular views of the Guadalcacín reservoir. Pepe ElPiketa super caring and best professional. 10 points for Pepe.
Danger! Access to the farm works via a transponder for the gate. This transponder is located on the right side of the gate, in a mini safe with a numeric code.
You get the number code when you call Pepe.
Pepe's phone number or email address can be found under the menu item "Contact".
Of particular note are the shaded picnic areas and children's playgrounds, which are also shaded, the pool and the free-roaming horses and sheep.

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra -
description: Just in front of a small amusement park in the middle of nature after the village of Zahara, we spent a very quiet night there. Accessible to large motorhomes.

title: () El Gastor - A-2300
description: Large "shaded" area dedicated to water sports at the end of the lake, open this 17th of April 2017 but gate can be padlocked, several motorhomes, ideal for dogs and very quiet.

title: (11688) El Gastor - Unnamed Road
description: On the side of the road, just a free public fountain source. With the possibility of direct filling of the tank. Poster of the town hall indicating that this water has no sanitary control.

title: (11639) Algar -
description: Very nice spot right on the water next to an old road that leads to the reservoir. The entrance to the square is blocked by a gate, but this only serves to keep the cows indoors in the surrounding fields. You can find out by reading the signs or asking the locals. Nobody was bothered by our presence here. So to close the gate behind you again! It could be that cows are walking around here, but we didn't see any.

title: (11687) El Gastor -
description: Not paved, quiet and relatively flat outdoors for max. 5-8 vehicles on a promontory. No shade, no service and no prohibition signs. Satisfactory mobile phone prohibited at night.

title: (41719) Utrera - 7 SE-9015
description: Large parking next to the village, beautiful cloister impossible to visit.

title: (11689) La Muela -
description:
From the road, follow the very good dirt road for 1km; keep straight on it. Super accessible. It is a big clearing with many picnic tables and fire places and big waste bins. Secluded, completely quiet and shaded by trees, if you want. The clearing is - except for the entrance - protected by rocks and fences.
There are some big pigs on farmland right next to the clearing. Some few almost level spots, most parts a little bit sloped. Too many giant motorhomes at the same time probably don't fit well, but there is lots of space.
You can easily stay there over night(s).

title: (11600) Ubrique - 9 Diseminado la Carretera
description: Place to spend the night and visit the town on foot. Noisy, since it is the entrance and exit of the town and many cars pass by. We were interested in this place because we go to the Ubrique rally climb every year, and it is very, very close to see the rally stage. If you are a fan, it is a good place to spend the days of the rally.

title: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 103 Calle Enrique Granados
title_short: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 103 Calle Enrique Granados
description: We spent a quiet night here. The parking bay is on a slope, but at the highest point we stood pretty straight with two mobile homes. Ideal for children because there is a really great playground in the adjacent park. Likewise, a dog training area, where there are two water taps. We could watch the locals filling up water there to drink. In the village there is a super delicious pizzeria called "Pizzaburger Mario" Great value for money and super tasty.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 2 Calle Harana
description: Newly refurbished motorhome parking area with black & grey disposal plus fresh water. No EHU. Narrow street to access & steep final access road, anything >8m not likely to manage. Lovely views over pretty town & hills. Lots of cafes & bars a few minutes walk away. Supermarket nearby. **tuesdays area used for large market so no access until late afternoon**

title: (11600) Ubrique - 36 Calle Fernando Gavilán
description: Quiet parking Beautiful views

title: (11612) Benaocaz - 3331 A-374

title: (11687) El Gastor - 42 CA-0419
description: Place with tables to eat in the shade of a pine forest. Several hiking trails depart from here. Nice view of the Gastor village.

title: (29430) Montecorto - Unnamed Road
description: Several small pitches for a motorhome on the edge of the path which leads to another spot a little lower. Here, it's flatter, the view is prettier and vehicles that are a bit wide are not scratched by the shrubs that invade the path below... Very quiet site.

title: (41530) Sevilla - 8A Carretera Montellano A-361
description: Quiet pine forest with lots of shade. Many trucks pass but shade is something that is scarce in the area. We only stopped to eat. We do not spend the night. There are garbage containers. Limited number of car parks as it is among pine trees.

title: (41730) Sacramento - 2 Calle Puerta del Verano
description: A local showed us that he was sleeping in this place and differs considerably from the pace recorded 200 meters before. In addition to the picnic tables under the pines, it also has a connection to the water and toilets.

title: (11687) El Gastor - 11 Calle Alambique
description: Parking at the entrance of the village on the road to Setenil. Quiet site with several hiking routes that leave the same town.

title: (11620) Jédula -
description: The town hall has set up a loading and unloading point. Always use good judgment and leave it as you would like to find it. Keep in mind that the town festivals are on the first weekend of June, so those 2 weeks cannot be used.

description: Villaluenga del Rosario on the road to the white villages. Artisanal cheeses. Potholing.

title: (11600) Ubrique -
description: I don't know how to classify this place, it doesn't have any services, other than a Picnic area nearby, it is accessed by a dirt road, and there is a long road and a lot of places to park. In the mornings quite a lot of people pass by but we did not have any problem, quite quiet and close to many places to see or to start excursions.

title: (29430) Montecorto -

title: (29430) Montecorto - 6 Arrabal Sup
description: Small landing for only 1 vehicle, and quite flat. The parking lot is right in front but it has a lot of unevenness and this place is flat. In the town there are bakeries, cafeterias and sources of drinking water. We had a fairly quiet night.

title_short: (11580) San José del Valle - 2 Calle Miguel de Cervantes

title: (29430) Montecorto - 4 Plaza Andalucía
description: Large parking lot of land next to a pine forest, rubbish and recycling bins inside the car park, children's playground inside the car park, site very quiet and 2 minutes from the town center on foot, the sun shines.

title: (29430) Montecorto - 2 Arrabal Sup-M
description: Small tap to fill up at the side of the road. No parking but road is quiet to pull over. We filled up here before heading to a nature parking spot.

title: (11580) San José del Valle -
description: Super quiet spot at the very top of San José del Valle, past the Camino de la Teja and the old cemetery. Please note that access is difficult! OK for a van in dry weather: climb in first gear on a stony path, otherwise 4x4. But once you arrive you will have a large flat space to park, with very nice views. Possibility to go up to the Cruz del Valle (but rather on foot or by bike, I think). Please keep the place clean!

title: (41749) El Cuervo de Sevilla -
description: Double car park of the Laguna Tollón Bird Observatory - Mirador la Mina. At the top we have a beautiful view but there is a very slight slope, and at the bottom there is a second flat parking lot. Both are gravelled and easily accessible. Depending on the direction of the wind you can hear the AP4 motorway a little but nothing disturbing. Please keep this place clean!

title: (11690) Olvera -
description: Right next to via verde. no services. the place is clean. thank you for preserving it. the path to get there is in the ground for 200m with some ruts. there is space for vehicles under 7m
